intro: Achras myrsinoides, commonly known as the red sandalwood, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its dense, aromatic wood and striking red coloration. The plant typically grows as a small tree or shrub, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a waxy texture, while its flowers are small and clustered in complex inflorescences. Due to its ornamental value and valuable timber, it is sometimes cultivated for horticultural purposes.
